abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Altaria by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Double Wing Attack
attacks.text: Does 20 Damage to each Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Hunch
abilities.text: As long as Beautifly's remaining HP is 40 or less, Beautifly does 40 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Luring Antenna
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to the new Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Leaf Poison
attacks.text: If Breloom has any Grass Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Back Burner
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Psychic Trace
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Claydol is your Active Pokémon, you may shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand. This power can't be used if Claydol is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Ancient Mantra
attacks.text: If Claydol has any Psychic Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If Claydol has any Fighting Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Dark Protection
abilities.text: Any damage done to Crawdaunt by your opponent's attacks is reduced by 10 for each Darkness Energy attached to Crawdaunt (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't reduce more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Psychic Removal
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, discard all Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Powerful Hand
attacks.text: Count the number of cards in your hand. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. You can't put more than 7 damage counters in this way.

attacks.name: Dragon Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Full Retaliation
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on all of your Magikarp.

attacks.name: Pulverize
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has at least 2 damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage plus 50 more damage.

abilities.name: Wishing Star
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Jirachi is your Active Pokémon, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. Jirachi and your other Active Pokémon, if any, are now Asleep. This power can't be used if Jirachi is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Metallic Blow
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Poké-Bodies, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Swing Dance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card. This power can't be used if Ludicolo is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Healing Steps
attacks.text: You may discard as many cards as you like from your hand. If you do, remove that many damage counters from Ludicolo.

attacks.name: Circular Steps
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's), excluding Ludicolo.

abilities.name: Super Connectivity
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Psychic or Metal Energy card and attach it to your Active Pokémon. Then, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Metagross is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If Metagross and the Defending Pokémon have a different amount of Energy attached to them, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 70.

attacks.name: Seek Out
attacks.text: Search your deck for 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Pull Away
attacks.text: If your opponent has 5 or more cards in his or her hand, your opponent discards a number of cards until your opponent has 4 cards left in his or her hand.

abilities.name: Fast Protection
abilities.text: Prevent all effects, including damage, done to Ninjask by your opponent's attacks from his or her Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Ninjask's Slash attack's base damage is 80.

abilities.name: Empty Shell
abilities.text: When Shedinja is Knocked Out, your opponent doesn't take any Prize cards.

attacks.name: Extra Curse
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, put 4 damage counters instead.

abilities.name: Lazy Aura
abilities.text: As long as Slaking is your Active Pokémon, any damage done by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex is reduced by 30 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lazy Headbutt
attacks.text: Slaking is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If Deoxys and the Defending Pokémon have a different amount of Energy attached to them, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 40.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Barrier Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Deoxys by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

abilities.name: Happy Dance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Happy Dance Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Ludicolo is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Water Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to Ludicolo. This attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Smooth Over
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a card. Shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of your deck. This power can't be used if Magcargo is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

attacks.name: Bay Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, if any of your current Active Pokémon does damage to any Defending Pokémon, the attack does 30 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

abilities.name: Dragon Aura
abilities.text: As long as Rayquaza has any basic Fire Energy cards and any basic Lightning Energy cards attached to it, prevent all effects, except damage, by an opponent's attack done to Rayquaza.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Night Vision
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Sableye is your Active Pokémon, you may look at your opponent's hand. This power can't be used if Sableye is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Limitation
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Supporter Cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Triple Breach
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of those Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Fan Action
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Benched Pokémon to switch. This power can't be used if Shiftry is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Stadium Power
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Metallic Lift
abilities.text: If Skarmory has any Metal Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Skarmory is 0.

attacks.name: Spearhead

attacks.name: Heavy Metal
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Metal Energy attached to Skarmory. This attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Tropical Motion
abilities.text: As long as Tropius is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon have no Resistance.

attacks.name: Miracle Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Raging Tremble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on Whiscash to each Defending Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on Whiscash to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Mirror Coat
abilities.text: If Xatu is Burned or Poisoned by an opponent's attack (even if Xatu is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now affected by the same Special Conditions (1 if there is only 1).

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Psyloop
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 30 more damage for each Trainer card your opponent has in play.

attacks.name: Spinning Horn
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

abilities.text: Golbat can't be Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Golbat.

abilities.name: Carefree
abilities.text: Grumpig can't be Confused.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Extra Ball
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Aqua Lift

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Natural Cure

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Lombre.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

abilities.name: Moonglow
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost for each Solrock you have in play is 0.

attacks.name: Foresight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.

attacks.name: Target Beam
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Solrock you have in play.

attacks.name: Burning Ball
attacks.text: If Magcargo has at least 2 Fire Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.text: You may do 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to Manectric. If you do, Manectric does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.text: As long as Masquerain is your Active Pokémon, any damage done by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't use more than 1 Intimidating Pattern Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Negative Spark
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Poké-Bodies. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Nosepass is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. This power can't be used if Nosepass is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Positive Spark
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

abilities.name: Hard Protection

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Silcoon by your opponent's Evolved Pokémon.

abilities.name: Sunbeam
abilities.text: The maximum HP for each Lunatone you have in play is now 80.

attacks.name: Scorching Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Reflected Beam
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon for each Lunatone you have in play. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.text: As long as Starmie has any Psychic Energy attached to it, damage done to Starmie by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Energy Flip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) You may move an Energy attached to that Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Boom
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mid-air Crush
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent discards 1 Energy card, if any, attached to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nosedive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Swellow does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Vigorous Aura
abilities.text: As long as Vigoroth is your Active Pokémon, attacks by each player's Active Pokémon (both if there are 2) do 10 more damage to any Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Liability
attacks.text: Put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until it is 10 HP away from being Knocked Out. Weezing does 70 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Smogscreen
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Baltoy does 50 damage to itself.

attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Rage

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Surskit during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Fluff
abilities.text: Whenever Swablu would be damaged or affected by an opponent's attack and already has at least 1 damage counter on it, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Swablu.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Wurmple and put it on Wurmple. (This counts as evolving Wurmple.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Miracle Essence
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Special Condition. Each Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

abilities.name: Self-control
abilities.text: Zubat can't be Paralyzed.

name: Balloon Berry
rules: When the Pokémon Balloon Berry is attached to retreats, discard Balloon Berry instead of discarding Energy cards.

name: Crystal Shard
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon's type (color) is Colorless. If that Pokémon attacks, discard this card at the end of the turn.

name: Energy Charge
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, shuffle up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Lady Outing
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 different types of basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Master Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Meteor Falls
rules: Each player's Active Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon or its Stage 1 Evolution card. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Professor Cozmo's Discovery
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, draw the bottom 3 cards of your deck. If tails, draw the top 2 cards of your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Space Center
rules: Ignore Poké-Bodies for all Basic Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) (excluding Pokémon-ex and Pokémon that has an owner in its name).
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Strength Charm
rules: Whenever an attack from the Pokémon that Strength Charm is attached to does damage (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage. At the end of your turn in which this happens, discard Strength Charm.

name: Heal Energy
rules: Heal Energy provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, remove 1 damage counter and all Special Conditions from that Pokémon. If Heal Energy is attached to Pokémon-ex, Heal Energy has no effect other than providing Energy.

abilities.name: Distortion
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Crobat ex is your Active Pokémon, you may put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This power can't be used if Crobat ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Cross Attack
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 damage plus 40 more damage.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys ex and switch it with Deoxys ex. (Any cards attached to Deoxys ex, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys ex on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Energy Burst
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Deoxys ex and the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys ex and switch it with Deoxys ex. (Any cards attached to Deoxys ex, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys ex on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys ex and switch it with Deoxys ex. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Deoxys ex by your opponent's Pokémon-ex during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Hariyama ex by attacks is increased by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards (except for Supporter cards) from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Manectric ex and then choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.text: Does 20 damage for each basic Energy card attached to Rayquaza ex.

abilities.name: Dragon Lift
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost for each of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Baby Pokémon) is 0.

attacks.name: Flame Jet

attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Salamence ex.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to the new Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.text: You may discard a Darkness Energy attached to Sharpedo ex. If you do, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage and discard 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon (including Latias Star).

attacks.name: Shooting Star
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, discard all Energy cards attached to Latias Star and this attack does 50 damage plus 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Miraculous Light
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter and all Special Conditions from Latios Star.

attacks.name: Shining Star
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon, discard all Energy cards attached to Latios Star and this attack does 50 damage plus 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Spiral Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Holy Star
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Rayquaza Star. This attack does 100 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon-ex. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Lightning Burst
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Darkness Energy card from your hand to Rocket's Raikou ex, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon and switch it with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Benched Pokémon to switch. This power can't be used if Rocket's Raikou ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Thunderous Blow
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to Rocket's Raikou ex.
